title: Henna Tattoos and High Tea
name: Henna Tattoos and High Tea
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

This map shows Places where you can go out in San Francisco to get henna tattoos and high tea. I made this map thinking about something fun a mother and daughter could do together. If you know of a good place for henna or for tea, please add it to the map.

properties.name: Alpenglo Tea
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  401 Sansome Street, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Bombay Ice Creamery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  552 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA Ice-cream parlor, Indian boutique, sari shop. Buy a do-it-yourself henna tattoo kit!

properties.name: Cinta Salon
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  23 Grant Ave # 2, San Francisco, CA (415) 989-1000. Located above Bebe clothing store. Bhavna Patel, a henna artist hailing from the Indian state of Gujarat, has created her own book full of elegant designs to choose from. Or you can design something yourself for any body part you wish to be covered. (metroactive)

properties.name: DynasTEA
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1390 Pacific Ave, San Francisco, CA This place is a gem! That said, this is not the place if you\'\'re looking for a boisterous get together. Tea is meant to be tasted with all your senses here and that calls for a quiet environment. The perfect place for quiet time alone. (adagio.com)

properties.name: Farley's
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    1315 18th Street, San Francisco, CAFarley\'s goal is to create a focal point for the community where everyone is comfortable and feels welcome. By creating a personable place, a human place, Farley\'s provides an arena for people to interact with one another. The character of Farley\'s mirrors the uniqueness of the people and allows for a genuine and distinctive experience for everyone.

properties.name: Imperial Tea Court
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   1411 Powell Street, San Francisco, CA I find the teas of the highest quality and the service excellent and friendly. The staff is more than willing to spend time and provide all the information on teas and preparation that is desired. And the atmosphere is great. (Adagio.com)

properties.name: Jadebrook Teahouse
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  946 Leavenworth Street, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Kamalaspa Day Spa
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  240 Stockton St, San Francisco, CA7th floor. From the minute you walk into this extravagantly decorated Indian temple, you are instantly transported to an oasis of relaxation and stress-free comfort. All the attention you receive by the gracious staff that welcomes you in, foreshadows on what could well be the most amazing spa experience you have ever encountered. (yelp)

properties.name: Leland Tea Company
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing    1416 Bush St, San Francisco, CA The interior is very hip but does not have that \'\'estrogen bomb\'\' feeling that a lot of the lady-centered tea rooms have. The prices are very fair, the service is extremely friendly and accommodating and they\'\'ll even let you mix your own recipe from loose leaf and then keep it on file so you can remember what you had the next time you come in. (adagio.com)

properties.name: Life Henna Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing 604 Haight St, San Francisco, CACall ahead of time: (415) 864-3662.

properties.name: Lovejoy's Tea Room
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1351 Church Street, San Francisco, CA http://www.lovejoystearoom.com/ If you want to pretend to be a British peer with tons of servants, go to the Ritz, but if you want to be treated as family in a place where my English Grandmother would have felt right at home, go to Lovejoy\'\'s. (Adagio.com)

properties.name: Parco Coffee and Tea
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  350 Hayes Street, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Samovar Tea Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   498 Sanchez Street, San Francisco, CA, 94114 Fantastic flavors in the food. Incredible selection of teas. (adagio.com)

properties.name: Spike's Coffees and Teas
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   4117 19th Street, San Franciso, CA 94114 Take your time, enjoy some pastry and ask to smell any tea that strikes your fancy. Spike\'\'s staff is excellent and knowledgeable and can help you find the right tea for the mood in your in. Fabulous place. (adagio.com)

properties.name: Ten Ren Tea
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  949 Grant Ave., San Francisco, CA The Grant Ave. Ten Ren is a great place to recover from hillwalking, or the daggers of a summer S.F. fog. Try the high mountain oolongs and the \'\'King\'\'s Tea\'\' varieties--oolongs with Wisconsin ginseng. (Adagio.com)

properties.name: The Garden Court
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  2 New Montgomery Street, San Francisco, CA Saturday only, 2:00pm to 4:00pm. When the Palace Hotel opened its doors in 1875, the Garden Court was the carriage entrance to this grand hotel. A parade of famous guests visited San Francisco\'\'s Palace and stood in awe of its magnificence. In 1906, following the earthquake, the Palace closed its doors for the first restoration. Three years later, the carriage entrance was transformed and The Garden Court was unveiled. Since its debut in 1909, The Garden Court has been recognized as one of the world\'\'s most beautiful public spaces. Poor reviews from Adagio.com.

properties.name: Windsor Tea Room
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  334 Mason Street, San Francisco, CA Plenty of food here to enjoy, tea selection was good too. (Adagio.com)
